CMHTML.php

00001 <?php
00002 
00003 include_once("CMClass.php");
00004 
00005 // commit 3
00006 
00026 class CMHTML implements CMClass {
00027  
00065  public static function Table($a) {
00066   // convert queries to data, we dont want to convert the 'data' key because it might be
00067   // very large
00068   foreach($a as $k => $v) {
00069    if($a[$k] instanceof CMQueryProtocol && $k != 'data')
00070     $a[$k] = $a[$k]->fetchAll('cell', 'vertical');
00071   }
00072   
00073   // create the <table> tag
00074   $r = "<table";
00075   foreach($a as $k => $v) {
00076    if(!in_array($k, array('data', 'header')))
00077     $r .= " $k=\"$v\"";
00078   }
00079   $r .= ">";
00080   
00081   // header
00082   if(isset($a['header'])) {
00083    $r .= "<tr>";
00084    foreach($a['header'] as $cell)
00085     $r .= "<th>$cell</th>";
00086    $r .= "</tr>";
00087   }
00088   
00089   // a normal data array
00090   if(is_array($a['data'])) {
00091    foreach($a['data'] as $row) {
00092     $r .= "<tr>";
00093     foreach($row as $cell)
00094      $r .= "<td>$cell</td>";
00095     $r .= "</tr>";
00096    }
00097   }
00098   
00099   // a database query handle
00100   elseif($a['data'] instanceof CMQueryProtocol) {
00101    while($row = $a['data']->fetch()) {
00102     $r .= "<tr>";
00103     foreach($row as $cell)
00104      $r .= "<td>$cell</td>";
00105     $r .= "</tr>";
00106    }
00107   }
00108   
00109   $r .= "</table>\n";
00110   return $r;
00111  }
00112  
00116  public function __toString() {
00117   return "<" . get_class($this) . ">";
00118  }
00119  
00120 }
00121 
00122 ?>
